Author: Mark Twain
Quote: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  The Intern
Quote: When someone loves you, the way they talk about you is different. You feel safe and comfortable.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Importance of Being Earnest
Quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Quote: The truth."Dumbledore sighed. "It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.

Author: Joe Klaas,  Twelve Steps to Happiness
Quote: The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games
Quote: I am not pretty. I am not beautiful. I am as radiant as the sun.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always.

Author: George Orwell,  1984
Quote: Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood.

Author: Aldous Huxley,  Complete Essays 2, 1926-29
Quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?

Author: George Carlin,  When Will Jesus Bring The Pork Chops?
Quote: Here's all you have to know about men and women: women are crazy, men are stupid. And the main reason women are crazy is that men are stupid.

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  The Brothers Karamazov
Quote: Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it.

Author: George Orwell
Quote: In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act.

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.

Author: Socrates
Quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.

Author: S.E. Hinton,  The Outsiders
Quote: I lie to myself all the time. But I never believe me.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.

Author: William Faulkner
Quote: Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed. If people all over the world...would do this, it would change the earth.

Author: Mark Twain,  Following the Equator: A Journey Around the World
Quote: Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't.

Author: Stephanie Klein,  Straight Up and Dirty
Quote: Tell the truth, or someone will tell it for you.

Author: Flannery O'Connor
Quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.

Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind
Quote: Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you.

Author: Pablo Picasso
Quote: Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: The more I see, the less I know for sure.

Author: Jim Morrison
Quote: The most important kind of freedom is to be what you really are. You trade in your reality for a role. You trade in your sense for an act. You give up your ability to feel, and in exchange, put on a mask. There can't be any large-scale revolution until there's a personal revolution, on an individual level. It's got to happen inside first.

Author: Kalu Ndukwe Kalu
Quote: The things you do for yourself are gone when you are gone, but the things you do for others remain as your legacy.

Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden
Quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: The truth is, unless you let go, unless you forgive yourself, unless you forgive the situation, unless you realize that the situation is over, you cannot move forward.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.

Author: Socrates
Quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  Just Listen

"That's not how I meant it, anyways.""How'd you mean it, then?""I just...I don't always say what I feel.""Why not?""Because the truth sometimes hurts,"I said."Yeah,"he said. "So do lies, though.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez,  One Hundred Years of Solitude
Quote: It's enough for me to be sure that you and I exist at this moment.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: There are no facts, only interpretations.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.

Author: Robert Orben
Quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.

Author: Thomas Merton,  No Man Is an Island
Quote: The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image. If in loving them we do not love what they are, but only their potential likeness to ourselves, then we do not love them: we only love the reflection of ourselves we find in them

Author: François de La Rochefoucauld
Quote: No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.

Author: Eckhart Tolle
Quote: The past has no power over the present moment.

Author: William Blake,  Auguries of Innocence
Quote: A truth that's told with bad intentBeats all the lies you can invent.

Author: Edward Abbey
Quote: Better a cruel truth than a comfortable delusion.

Author: Michelle Hodkin,  The Unbecoming of Mara Dyer
Quote: Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.

Author: Bruce Feirstein
Quote: The distance between insanity and genius is measured only by success.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.

Author: Jack Kerouac
Quote: The only truth is music.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Committed: A Skeptic Makes Peace with Marriage
Quote: To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow - this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the story my great-grandfather told my father, who then told my grandfather, who then told me about how The Mythical Mr. Boo, Charles Manseur Fizzlebush Grissham III, better known as Mr. Fizzlebush, and Orafoura are all in fact me...
Quote: Nothing, Everything, Anything, Something: If you have nothing, then you have everything, because you have the freedom to do anything, without the fear of losing something.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay"we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.

Author: David Foster Wallace,  Infinite Jest
Quote: The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.

Author: Tim O'Brien
Quote: That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.

Author: Hayley Williams
Quote: Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand

Author: Nadine Gordimer
Quote: The truth isn't always beauty, but the hunger for it is.

Author: Greg Behrendt
Quote: I'm about to make a wild, extreme and severe relationship rule: the word busy is a load of crap and is most often used by assholes. The word "busy"is the relationship Weapon of Mass Destruction. It seems like a good excuse, but in fact in every silo you uncover, all you're going to find is a man who didn't care enough to call. Remember men are never to busy to get what they want.

Author: George R.R. Martin,  A Game of Thrones
Quote: Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.

Author: George Washington
Quote: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.

Author: Lemony Snicket,  Horseradish
Quote: It is difficult, when faced with a situation you cannot control, to admit you can do nothing.

Author: Lemony Snicket,  Horseradish
Quote: There are times to stay put, and what you want will come to you, and there are times to go out into the world and find such a thing for yourself.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.

Author: Catherine Deneuve
Quote: A woman has to be intelligent, have charm, a sense of humor, and be kind. It's the same qualities I require from a man.

Author: Katherine Boo,  Behind the Beautiful Forevers: Life, Death, and Hope in a Mumbai Undercity
Quote: Much of what was said did not matter, and that much of what mattered could not be said.

Author: Sophie Kinsella,  The Undomestic Goddess
Quote: There’s no such thing as ruining your life. Life’s a pretty resilient thing, it turns out.

Author: Malcolm X
Quote: I'm for truth, no matter who tells it. I'm for justice, no matter who it is for or against. I'm a human being, first and foremost, and as such I'm for whoever and whatever benefits humanity as a whole.

Author: George R.R. Martin,  A Clash of Kings
Quote: People often claim to hunger for truth, but seldom like the taste when it's served up.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: We live in an age when unnecessary things are our only necessities.

Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching
Quote: The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes
Quote: Something inside Clary cracked and broke, and words came pouring out. 'What do you want me to tell you? The truth? The truth is that I love Simon like I should love you, and I wish he was my brother and you weren't, but I can't do anything about that and neither can you!

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.

Author: Anne Lamott
Quote: You can safely assume you've created God in your own image when it turns out that God hates all the same people you do.

Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Blank Book
Quote: Just because you don't understand it doesn't mean it isn't so.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Princess
Quote: Men may be stronger, but it is women who endure.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: A thinker sees his own actions as experiments and questions--as attempts to find out something. Success and failure are for him answers above all.

Author: John Green,  Paper Towns
Quote: Nothing ever happens like you imagine it will

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure truth.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I think that we are like stars. Something happens to burst us open; but when we burst open and think we are dying; we’re actually turning into a supernova. And then when we look at ourselves again, we see that we’re suddenly more beautiful than we ever were before!

Author: Wallace Stevens
Quote: Perhaps the truth depends on a walk around the lake.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: 1492. As children we were taught to memorize this year with pride and joy as the year people began living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America. Actually, people had been living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America for hundreds of years before that. 1492 was simply the year sea pirates began to rob, cheat, and kill them.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: Sometimes things become possible if we want them bad enough.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  The Intern
Quote: Those sweet lips. My, oh my, I could kiss those lips all night long.Good things come to those who wait.

Author: Blaise Pascal
Quote: Truth is so obscure in these times, and falsehood so established, that, unless we love the truth, we cannot know it.

Author: Jessamyn West
Quote: Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.

Author: Nisargadatta Maharaj
Quote: It is always the false that makes you suffer, the false desires and fears, the false values and ideas, the false relationships between people. Abandon the false and you are free of pain; truth makes happy, truth liberates.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Truth never damages a cause that is just.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Quote: All truth passes through three stages: First, it is ridiculed; Second, it is violently opposed; Third, it is accepted as self-evident.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  Franny and Zooey
Quote: I’m just sick of ego, ego, ego. My own and everybody else’s. I’m sick of everybody that wants to get somewhere, do something distinguished and all, be somebody interesting. It’s disgusting.

Author: Charles Bukowski,  Hot Water Music
Quote: Life's as kind as you let it be.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Great Listener Seeks Mute Women
Quote: Whether you live to be 50 or 100 makes no difference, if you made no difference in the world.

Author: Dorothy L. Sayers
Quote: Facts are like cows. If you look them in the face long enough, they generally run away.

Author: Voltaire
Quote: Love truth, but pardon error.

Author: Terry Goodkind
Quote: If the road is easy, you're likely going the wrong way.

Author: Carl Sagan,  The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark
Quote: For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: Three things can not hide for long: the Moon, the Sun and the Truth.

Author: Ally Carter,  Heist Society

Author: Greg Behrendt,  He's Just Not That Into You: The No-Excuses Truth to Understanding Guys

Author: George Orwell,  In Front of Your Nose: 1945-1950
Quote: The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard
Quote: There are two ways to be fooled. One is to believe what isn't true; the other is to refuse to believe what is true.

Author: Oscar Wilde

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Keeping Faith

Author: Jess C. Scott,  The Devilin Fey

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: You never know how much you really believe anything until its truth or falsehood becomes a matter of life and death to you.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar

Author: Dorothy Allison,  Bastard Out of Carolina
Quote: Things come apart so easily when they have been held together with lies.

Author: Yevgeny Yevtushenko
Quote: When truth is replaced by silence,the silence is a lie.

Author: Melina Marchetta,  Saving Francesca

Author: André Gide
Quote: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  The Other Side of Life
Quote: Friends are the family you choose (~ Nin/Ithilnin, Elven rogue).

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: Who is more humble? The scientist who looks at the universe with an open mind and accepts whatever the universe has to teach us, or somebody who says everything in this book must be considered the literal truth and never mind the fallibility of all the human beings involved?

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  A Confession
Quote: Wrong does not cease to be wrong because the majority share in it.

Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,  Speak
Quote: I have survived. I am here. Confused, screwed up, but here. So, how can I find my way? Is there a chain saw of the soul, an ax I can take to my memories or fears?

Author: Georges Bataille,  Violent Silence: Celebrating Georges Bataille
Quote: I believe that truth has only one face: that of a violent contradiction.

Author: John Steinbeck,  East of Eden
Quote: There's more beauty in truth, even if it is dreadful beauty.

Author: Charlie Chaplin
Quote: A man's true character comes out when he's drunk.

Author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant
Quote: You don’t believe things because they make your life better, you believe them because they’re true.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I don't understand people who say they need more "Me Time."What other time is there? Do these people spend part of their day in someone else's body?

Author: Søren Kierkegaard
Quote: The most common form of despair is not being who you are.

Author: Jane Austen,  Emma

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Live your truth. Express your love. Share your enthusiasm. Take action towards your dreams. Walk your talk. Dance and sing to your music. Embrace your blessings. Make today worth remembering.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about its own things. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble. Matthew 6:34

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: The Bible has noble poetry in it... and some good morals and a wealth of obscenity, and upwards of a thousand lies.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Author: John Keats
Quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the Heart's affections and the truth of the Imagination.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live up to what light I have.

Author: Margaret Atwood,  The Blind Assassin
Quote: The only way you can write the truth is to assume that what you set down will never be read. Not by any other person, and not even by yourself at some later date. Otherwise you begin excusing yourself. You must see the writing as emerging like a long scroll of ink from the index finger of your right hand; you must see your left hand erasing it.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: Boredom: the desire for desires.

Author: George Orwell,  1984
Quote: Being in a minority, even in a minority of one, did not make you mad. There was truth and there was untruth, and if you clung to the truth even against the whole world, you were not mad.

Author: Henry David Thoreau

Author: Jess C. Scott
Quote: A fit, healthy body—that is the best fashion statement

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Alice Sebold,  The Lovely Bones
Quote: Nothing is ever certain.

Author: Walter Scott,  Marmion
Quote: Oh, what a tangled web we weave...when first we practice to deceive.

Author: Sara Gruen,  Water for Elephants
Quote: With a secret like that, at some point the secret itself becomes irrelevant. The fact that you kept it does not.

Author: Doris Lessing,  Under My Skin: Volume One of My Autobiography, to 1949
Quote: There is no doubt fiction makes a better job of the truth.

Author: Criss Jami

Author: Jess C. Scott,  Wicked Lovely
Quote: I felt like an animal, and animals don’t know sin, do they?

Author: Albert Camus,  The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays
Quote: Man is always prey to his truths. Once he has admitted them, he cannot free himself from them.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: You’re not obligated to win. You’re obligated to keep trying. To the best you can do everyday.

Author: William Wilberforce
Quote: You may choose to look the other way but you can never say again that you did not know.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the best book I've ever written, and it still sucks
Quote: She says he says, but she could be lying to me, and he could be lying to her, so I can’t believe her, even if I could believe her.

Author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays
Quote: I quote others only in order the better to express myself.

Author: John Lennon,  Beatles Lyrics
Quote: Nothing is real.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451
Quote: But you can't make people listen. They have to come round in their own time, wondering what happened and why the world blew up around them. It can't last.

Author: Albert Camus,  The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays
Quote: Seeking what is true is not seeking what is desirable.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  EyeLeash: A Blog Novel
Quote: V-Day…if you need this one day in a year to show everyone else you truly care for “your loved one” I think it’s quite stupid. I hate this commercialism. It’s all artificial, and has nothing to do with real love.

Author: June Ahern
Quote: How hurtful it can be to deny one's true self and live a life of lies just to appease others.

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: The truth is not for all men but only for those who seek it.

Author: Sue Monk Kidd,  The Secret Life of Bees:
Quote: Knowing can be a curse on a person's life. I'd traded in a pack of lies for a pack of truth, and I didn't know which one was heavier. Which one took the most strength to carry around? It was a ridiculous question, though, because once you know the truth, you can't ever go back and pick up your suitcase of lies. Heavier or not, the truth is yours now.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: Muhammad has always been standing higher than the Christianity. He does not consider god as a human being and never makes himself equal to God. Muslims worship nothing except God and Muhammad is his Messenger. There is no any mystery and secret in it.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: I’ve come to the conclusion that people who wear headphones while they walk, are much happier, more confident, and more beautiful individuals than someone making the solitary drudge to work without acknowledging their own interests and power.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Macbeth
Quote: What's done cannot be undone.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: Transformation is my favorite game and in my experience, anger and frustration are the result of you not being authentic somewhere in your life or with someone in your life. Being fake about anything creates a block inside of you. Life can’t work for you if you don’t show up as you.

Author: James Joyce,  Ulysses
Quote: History, Stephen said, is a nightmare from which I am trying to awake.

Author: Tim O'Brien,  The Things They Carried
Quote: A thing may happen and be a total lie; another thing may not happen and be truer than the truth.

Author: A.W. Tozer
Quote: What comes into our minds when we think about God is the most important thing about us.

Author: Pema Chödrön,  When Things Fall Apart: Heart Advice for Difficult Times
Quote: The most fundamental aggression to ourselves, the most fundamental harm we can do to ourselves, is to remain ignorant by not having the courage and the respect to look at ourselves honestly and gently.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: If someone is able to show me that what I think or do is not right, I will happily change, for I seek the truth, by which no one was ever truly harmed. It is the person who continues in his self-deception and ignorance who is harmed.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Sea of Monsters
Quote: Does truth have a moral?

Author: Niels Bohr
Quote: Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future.

Author: Leila Sales,  This Song Will Save Your Life
Quote: Sometimes people think they know you. They know a few facts about you, and they piece you together in a way that makes sense to them. And if you don't know yourself very well, you might even believe that they are right. But the truth is, that isn't you. That isn't you at all.

Author: Orson Scott Card,  Ender's Game
Quote: I think it's impossible to really understand somebody, what they want, what they believe, and not love them the way they love themselves.

Author: José N. Harris
Quote: There is beauty in truth, even if it's painful. Those who lie, twist life so that it looks tasty to the lazy, brilliant to the ignorant, and powerful to the weak. But lies only strengthen our defects. They don't teach anything, help anything, fix anything or cure anything. Nor do they develop one's character, one's mind, one's heart or one's soul.

Author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Quote: Anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job.

Author: Niels Bohr
Quote: The opposite of a correct statement is a false statement. But the opposite of a profound truth may well be another profound truth.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: On some positions, cowardice asks the question, is it expedient? And then expedience comes along and asks the question, is it politic? Vanity asks the question, is it popular? Conscience asks the question, is it right?There comes a time when one must take the position that is neither safe nor politic nor popular, but he must do it because conscience tells him it is right.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace
Quote: There is no greatness where there is not simplicity, goodness, and truth.

Author: Sarah J. Maas,  Crown of Midnight
Quote: The best lies were always mixed with truth.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.

Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars
Quote: Sometimes people don’t understandthe promises they’re making when they make them,” I said.Isaac shot me a look. “Right, of course.But you keep the promise anyway. That’swhat love is. Love is keeping the promise anyway. Don’t you believe in true love?

Author: Kami Garcia,  Beautiful Darkness
Quote: We don't get to chose what is true. We only get to choose what we do about it.

Author: Darren Shan
Quote: Real life's nasty. It's cruel. It doesn't care about heroes and happy endings and the way things should be. In real life, bad things happen. People die. Fights are lost. Evil often wins.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't being said. The art of reading between the lines is a life long quest of the wise.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: It’s strange how dreams get under your skin and give your heart a test for what’s real and what’s imaginary.

Author: Isaac Newton
Quote: I do not know what I may appear to the world, but to myself I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the sea-shore, and diverting myself in now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.

Author: Flannery O'Connor,  Collected Works: Wise Blood / A Good Man is Hard to Find / The Violent Bear it Away / Everything that Rises Must Converge / Essays and Letters
Quote: You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you odd.

Author: H.G. Wells
Quote: The forceps of our minds are clumsy forceps, and crush the truth a little in taking hold of it.

Author: Scott Westerfeld,  Extras
Quote: I guess sometimes you have to lie to find the truth.

Author: Robin Hobb,  Assassin's Apprentice
Quote: When you cut pieces out of the truth to avoid looking like a fool you end up looking like a moron instead.

Author: Elvis Presley
Quote: Truth is like the sun. You can shut it out for a time, but it ain't going away.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Reputation is what others think of us; character is what God knows of us. When you have spent what feels like eternity trying to repair a few moments of time that destroyed the view others once had of you then you must ask yourself if you have the problem or is it really them? God doesn’t make us try so hard, only enemies do.

Author: Czesław Miłosz

Author: Jarod Kintz,  99 Cents For Some Nonsense
Quote: Between hello and goodbye is I love you.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: Trust starts with truth and ends with truth.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: The high-minded man must care more for the truth than for what people think.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Hamlet

Author: Mark Helprin,  Winter's Tale

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor
Quote: Honest is how I want to look. The truth doesn't glitter and shine.

Author: C.G. Jung

Author: Katherine Mansfield,  Journal of Katherine Mansfield

Author: René Descartes
Quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.

Author: Cormac McCarthy,  No Country For Old Men

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: Simple can be harder than complex: You have to work hard to get your thinking clean to make it simple. But it’s worth it in the end because once you get there, you can move mountains.

Author: Moderata Fonte,  The Worth of Women: Wherein Is Clearly Revealed Their Nobility and Their Superiority to Men
Quote: Do you really believe ... that everything historians tell us about men – or about women – is actually true? You ought to consider the fact that these histories have been written by men, who never tell the truth except by accident.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The truth is like a nipple: the more you twist it, the more somebody is going to get hurt.

Author: Banksy
Quote: Art should comfort the disturbed and disturb the comfortable.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  EyeLeash: A Blog Novel
Quote: My head’ll explode if I continue with this escapism.

Author: Sigmund Freud,  The Future of an Illusion
Quote: Religious doctrines … are all illusions, they do not admit of proof, and no one can be compelled to consider them as true or to believe in them.

Author: Charlaine Harris,  Dead as a Doornail
Quote: My bullshit meter is reading that as 'false'.

Author: Robert M. Pirsig,  Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values
Quote: The truth knocks on the door and you say, "Go away, I'm looking for the truth,"and so it goes away. Puzzling.

Author: Margaret Atwood
Quote: A truth should exist,it should not be usedlike this. If I love youis that a fact or a weapon?

Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska
Quote: What the hell is instant? Nothing is instant. Instant rice takes five minutes, instant pudding an hour. I doubt that an instant of blinding pain feels particularly instantaneous.

Author: Voltaire
Quote: Cherish those who seek the truth but beware of those who find it.

Author: Warsan Shire
Quote: Don't assume, ask. Be kind. Tell the truth. Don't say anything you can't stand behind fully. Have integrity. Tell people how you feel.

Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind
Quote: There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.

Author: D. Simone
Quote: May Light always surround you;Hope kindle and rebound you.May your Hurts turn to Healing;Your Heart embrace Feeling.May Wounds become Wisdom;Every Kindness a Prism.May Laughter infect you;Your Passion resurrect you.May Goodness inspire your Deepest Desires.Through all that you Reach For, May your arms Never Tire.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: The most perfidious way of harming a cause consists of defending it deliberately with faulty arguments.

Author: Jean-Paul Sartre
Quote: Like all dreamers I confuse disenchantment with truth.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: Time is precious, but truth is more precious than time.

Author: Veronica Roth,  Divergent
Quote: She has been to the compound before. She remembered this hallway. She knows about the initiation process. My mother was Dauntless.

Author: Malcolm X
Quote: Truth is on the side of the oppressed.

Author: Margaret Mitchell,  Gone with the Wind
Quote: Death, taxes and childbirth! There's never any convenient time for any of them.

Author: J.A. Konrath
Quote: One of the greatest journeys in life is overcoming insecurity and learning to truly not give a shit.

Author: Natsuki Takaya
Quote: I love the stars.Because they can't say anything.I love the stars.Because they do not judge anyone.

Author: Gena Showalter,  The Darkest Night
Quote: Sometimes what we want isn't what we need.

Author: Simone Elkeles,  How to Ruin Your Boyfriend's Reputation
Quote: Expectations make people miserable, so whatever yours are, lower them. You'll definitely be happier.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Unreturned love is like trying to make a sandwich with one slice of bread. Don’t stress—fold it in half and love yourself.

Author: Warren W. Wiersbe
Quote: Truth without love is brutality, and love without truth is hypocrisy.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want
Quote: I want to write a poem about "Truth,""Honor,""Dignity,"and whether the toilet paper should roll over or under when you pull on it.

Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti,  The First and Last Freedom
Quote: It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.

Author: Osho,  The Buddha Said...: Meeting the Challenge of Life's Difficulties
Quote: Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.

Author: Sara Shepard,  Heartless
Quote: No one believes a liar. Even when she's telling the truth.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: What I'm looking for is not out there, it is in me.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: Life, it’s made up of two things—time and love. A watch tells one, but what tells the other? We tell each other.

Author: John Keats,  The Complete Poems
Quote: Beauty is truth, truth beauty,—that is all Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know

Author: Bertrand Russell,  A History of Western Philosophy
Quote: To teach how to live without certainty, and yet without being paralyzed by hesitation, is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy, in our age, can still do for those who study it.

Author: Greg Behrendt
Quote: We're taught that in life, we should try to look on the bright side. Not in this case. In this case, assume rejection first. Assume you're the rule, not the exception. It's liberating. But we also know it's not an easy concept. -He's not just into you

Author: Max Brooks,  World War Z: An Oral History of the Zombie War
Quote: Lies are neither bad nor good. Like a fire they can either keep you warm or burn you to death, depending on how they're used.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and all science. He to whom this emotion is a stranger, who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead: his eyes are closed.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: The ideals which have always shone before me and filled me with joy are goodness, beauty, and truth.

Author: Irvin D. Yalom,  When Nietzsche Wept
Quote: Every person must choose how much truth he can stand.

Author: Lisa Lutz,  The Spellmans Strike Again
Quote: Our ability to adapt is amazing. Our ability to change isn't quite as spectacular.

Author: Michael Jackson
Quote: Lies run sprints, but the truth runs marathons.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  The Journals of Kierkegaard
Quote: The tyrant dies and his rule is over, the martyr dies and his rule begins.

Author: Harold Pinter,  Old Times
Quote: There are some things one remembers even though they may never have happened.

Author: Al Pacino
Quote: I always tell the truth. Even when I lie.

Author: Holly Black,  Red Glove
Quote: The truth is messy. It's raw and uncomfortable. You can't blame people for preferring lies.

Author: Emilie Autumn
Quote: You're so easy to read but the book is boring me.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The difference between you and everyone else, is everyone else. And that’s a lot, so you should feel special.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: Frustration and Love can’t exist in the same place at the same time, so get real and start doing what you would rather be doing in life. Love your life. All of it. Even the heavy shit that happened to you when you were 8. All of it was and IS perfect.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: I believe in the fundamental truth of all great religions of the world.

Author: Myra McEntire,  Hourglass
Quote: Most of what I say is complete truth. My edit button is broken.

Author: Lady Gaga
Quote: I'm telling you a lie in a vicious effort that you will repeat my lie over and over until it becomes true

Author: Nicole Yatsonsky
Quote: Your truest friends are the ones who will stand by you in your darkest moments--because they're willing to brave the shadows with you--and in your greatest moments--because they're not afraid to let you shine.

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: The truth may be puzzling. It may take some work to grapple with. It may be counterintuitive. It may contradict deeply held prejudices. It may not be consonant with what we desperately want to be true. But our preferences do not determine what's true.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: New International Version
Quote: I love the Lord, for he heard my voice; he heard my cry for mercy. Because he turned his ear to me, I will call on him as long as I live. (Psalms 116:1-2 NIV)

Author: Raymond E. Feist,  Silverthorn
Quote: Life is problems. Living is solving problems.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: Nothing is yet in its true form.

Author: Anton Chekhov
Quote: You have lost your reason and taken the wrong path. You have taken lies for truth, and hideousness for beauty. You would marvel if, owing to strange events of some sorts, frogs and lizards suddenly grew on apple and orange trees instead of fruit, or if roses began to smell like a sweating horse; so I marvel at you who exchange heaven for earth. I don't want to understand you.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Love now, not later. Also, love later.

Author: A.J. Russell
Quote: All sacrifice and suffering is redemptive. It is used to either teach the individual or to help others. Nothing is by chance.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My hands will get dirty holding your rose-shaped heart, because love is like gardening—it’s earthy and takes work to keep it alive.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye
Quote: It's partly true, too, but it isn't all true. People always think something's all true.

Author: Wil Zeus,  Sun Beyond the Clouds
Quote: Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Witches Abroad
Quote: Progress just means bad things happen faster.

Author: Daphne du Maurier,  Rebecca
Quote: I wondered how many people there were in the world who suffered, and continued to suffer, because they could not break out from their own web of shyness and reserve, and in their blindness and folly built up a great distorted wall in front of them that hid the truth.

Author: Emilio Estevez
Quote: We are all wonderful, beautiful wrecks. That's what connects us--that we're all broken, all beautifully imperfect.

Author: Noam Chomsky
Quote: Either you repeat the same conventional doctrines everybody is saying, or else you say something true, and it will sound like it's from Neptune.

Author: Augustine of Hippo
Quote: If you believe what you like in the Gospel, and reject what you don't like, it is not the Gospel you believe, but yourself.

Author: Corrie ten Boom,  The Hiding Place
Quote: In darkness God's truth shines most clear.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: If you're not comfortable enough with yourself or with your own truth when entering a relationship, then you're not ready for that relationship.

Author: Nicholas Sparks

Author: Jeanne Birdsall,  The Penderwicks on Gardam Street

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: We all know that Art is not truth. Art is a lie that makes us realize truth at least the truth that is given us to understand. The artist must know the manner whereby to convince others of the truthfulness of his lies.

Quote: The most confused you will ever get is when you try to convince your heart and spirit of something your mind knows is a lie.

Author: Jenny Han,  We'll Always Have Summer

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  The Hero of Ages
Quote: If you give up what you want most for what you think you should want more, you'll end up miserable.

That someone else's life would not have been as rich without us here.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
Quote: I became aware that the invincible power that has moved the world is unrequited, not happy, love.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel
Quote: It was odd, (Tessa thought), what brought out tenderness in people.

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  The Hero of Ages
Quote: Somehow, we'll find it. The balance between whom we wish to be and whom we need to be. But for now, we simply have to be satisfied with who we are.

Author: George Gordon Byron,  Don Juan
Quote: Tis strange,-but true; for truth is always strange;Stranger than fiction: if it could be told,How much would novels gain by the exchange!How differently the world would men behold!

Author: Ned Vizzini
Quote: you have to be the prude or the slut, and if you pick one, other people hate you for it, and you can’t trust anyone anymore, because they’re all after the same thing, and you see that you can never go back to how was before…

Author: Pope John Paul II
Quote: Faith and Reason are like two wings of the human spirit by which is soars to the truth.

Author: Louis-Ferdinand Céline,  Journey to the End of the Night
Quote: Not much music left inside us for life to dance to. Our youth has gone to the ends of the earth to die in the silence of the truth. And where, I ask you, can a man escape to, when he hasn't enough madness left inside him? The truth is an endless death agony. The truth is death. You have to choose: death or lies. I've never been able to kill myself.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  The Mystery of Marie Rogêt
Quote: Experience has shown, and a true philosophy will always show, that a vast, perhaps the larger, portion of truth arises from the seemingly irrelevant.

Author: Kirk Cameron
Quote: There is nothing more important than your eternal salvation.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: I believe that Gandhi’s views were the most enlightened of all the political men in our time. We should strive to do things in his spirit: not to use violence in fighting for our cause, but by non-participation in anything you believe is evil.

Author: Pedro Calderón de la Barca
Quote: In this treacherous worldNothing is the truth nor a lie.Everything depends on the colorOf the crystal through which one sees it

Author: Ami McKay,  The Birth House
Quote: No matter what you do, someone always knew you would.

Author: P.D. Ouspensky
Quote: When one realises one is asleep, at that moment one is already half-awake.

Author: Dorothy Day
Quote: Don't worry about being effective. Just concentrate on being faithful to the truth.

Author: Amy Plum,  Die for Me
Quote: My mom said I was an escapist at heart.... that I preferred imaginary worlds to the real one

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Plain Truth
Quote: If she spoke, she would tell him the truth: she was not okay at all, but horribly empty, now that she knew what it was like to be filled.

Author: Michael H. Hart,  The 100: A Ranking of the Most Influential Persons in History
Quote: My choice of Muhammad to lead the list of the world's most influential persons may surprise some readers and may be questioned by others, but he was the only man in history who was supremely successful on both the religious and secular level.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want Two apply for a job at our country's largest funeral home, and then wear a suit and noose to the job interview.
Quote: Before I die, I want to change my name to "Here,"so that my tombstone could simply read, "Here lies."And then people who knew me could walk by, shake their head, and say, "Ain't that the truth.

Author: Bill Watterson,  The Complete Calvin and Hobbes
Quote: Isn't it sad how some people's grip on their lives is so precarious that they'll embrace any preposterous delusion rather than face an occasional bleak truth?

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Catching Fire
Quote: Because, sometimes, things happen to people and they're not equipped to deal with them.

Author: Cristina Marrero
Quote: We never know when our last day on earth will be. So, love with full sincerity, believe with true faith, and hope with all of your might. Better to have lived in truth and discovered life, than to have lived half heartedly and died long before you ever ceased breathing.

Author: Tim O'Brien
Quote: A lie, sometimes, can be truer than the truth, which is why fiction gets written.

Author: Albert Schweitzer
Quote: Man is a clever animal who behaves like an imbecile.

Author: Brent Weeks,  The Way of Shadows
Quote: The perfect killer has no friends. Only targets.

Author: Crystal Woods,  Write like no one is reading
Quote: I know I'm not going to be in your head all the time. But once you know me, I'll be forever in your heart.

Author: E. Lockhart,  The Boyfriend List: 15 Guys, 11 Shrink Appointments, 4 Ceramic Frogs and Me, Ruby Oliver
Quote: When you hate someone you used to love, and you think he's done something awful - he probably has.

Author: Turcois Ominek
Quote: Don't doubt yourself, that's what haters are for.

Author: Neale Donald Walsch,  Home with God: In a Life That Never Ends
Quote: There is no truth except the truth that exists within you. Everything else is what someone is telling you.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Anyone who doesn't take truth seriously in small matters cannot be trusted in large ones either.

Author: Thomas Sowell,  Barbarians inside the Gates and Other Controversial Essays
Quote: People who pride themselves on their "complexity"and deride others for being "simplistic"should realize that the truth is often not very complicated. What gets complex is evading the truth.

Author: Kobayashi Issa
Quote: In the cherry blossom's shadethere's no such thingas a stranger.

Author: Audre Lorde,  The Cancer Journals
Quote: My silences had not protected me. Your silence will not protect you. But for every real word spoken, for every attempt I had ever made to speak those truths for which I am still seeking, I had made contact with other women while we examined the words to fit a world in which we all believed, bridging our differences.

Author: Robin McKinley,  Dragonhaven
Quote: But I'm going to try to tell the truth. Except for the parts I'm leav­ing out, because there's still stuff I'm just not going to tell you. Get used to it.

Author: Tite Kubo
Quote: I have always been afraid... Always been pretending to follow you closely, alwyas been pretending to sharpen my teeth, when the truth is, I am ... scared to death just treading on your shadow.

Author: Rumi
Quote: You are the Truth from foot to brow. Now, what else would you like to know?

Author: Ludwig Boltzmann
Quote: If you are out to describe the truth, leave elegance to the tailor.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: It is when you lose sight of yourself, that you lose your way. To keep your truth in sight you must keep yourself in sight and the world to you should be a mirror to reflect to you your image; the world should be a mirror that you reflect upon.

Author: John Locke
Quote: We are like chameleons, we take our hue and the color of our moral character, from those who are around us.

Author: J. Michael Straczynski
Quote: Understanding is a three edged sword: your side, their side, and the truth.

Author: Isaac Bashevis Singer,  Teibele And Her Demon
Quote: Night is a time of rigor, but also of mercy. There are truths which one can see only when it’s dark

Author: Italo Calvino,  Invisible Cities
Quote: Falsehood is never in words; it is in things.

Author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain
Quote: We too, must shatter the mirrors. We must look in to ourselves and root out the distortions until that thing which we know in our hearts is perfect and true, stands before us.

Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind
Quote: Few things are more deceptive than memories.

Author: David Sedaris
Quote: All I do is lie, and that has made me immune to compliments.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  There are Two Typos of People in This World: Those Who Can Edit and Those Who Can't
Quote: A lot of people go searching for “Truth.” But they can’t be searching too hard, because very few of them ever think to look under my bed.

Author: Sarah Addison Allen,  The Peach Keeper
Quote: Coffee, she'd discovered, was tied to all sorts of memories, different for each person. Sunday mornings, friendly get-togethers, a favorite grandfather long since gone, the AA meeting that saved their life. Coffee meant something to people. Most found their lives were miserable without it. Coffee was a lot like love that way. And because Rachel believed in love, she believed in coffee, too.

Author: St. Vincent de Paul
Quote: Humility is nothing but truth, and pride is nothing but lying.

Author: Sharon Shinn,  Jenna Starborn
Quote: A truth that no one knows is still the truth.

Author: William Penn
Quote: In all debates, let truth be thy aim, not victory, or an unjust interest.

Author: John Eldredge,  Wild at Heart: Discovering the Secret of a Man's Soul
Quote: I wasn't mean; I wasn't evil. I was nice. And let me tell you, a hesitant man is the last thing in the world a woman needs. She needs a lover and a warrior, not a Really Nice Guy.

Author: Pat Conroy,  The Great Santini
Quote: I’ve never had anyone’s approval, so I’ve learned to live without it.

Author: Linkin Park,  Linkin Park - Hybrid Theory
Quote: But I know just what it feels like to have a voice in the back of my head, like a face that I hold inside, face that awakes when I close my eyes, face that watches everytime I lie, face that laughs everytime I fall. (It watches EVERYTHING) ... But the face inside is hearing me, right beneath my skin.

Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo
Quote: Philosophy cannot be taught; it is the application of the sciences to truth.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: A man is never more truthful than when he acknowledges himself a liar.

Author: Bram Stoker,  The New Annotated Dracula
Quote: I suppose that we women are such cowards that we think a man will save us from fears, and we marry him.

Author: Sophie Kinsella,  The Undomestic Goddess
Quote: A mistake isn’t a mistake unless it can’t be put right.

Author: Woody Allen
Quote: All people know the same truth. Our lives consist of how we choose to distort it.

Author: Edmund Burke,  On Empire, Liberty, and Reform: Speeches and Letters
Quote: Whoever undertakes to set himself up as a judge of Truth and Knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the gods."[Preface to Brissot's Address to His Constituents (1794)]

Author: Joyce Carol Oates
Quote: And this is the forbidden truth, the unspeakable taboo - that evil is not always repellent but frequently attractive; that it has the power to make of us not simply victims, as nature and accident do, but active accomplices.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Write like no one is reading 3
Quote: Everyone is different from each other, but that doesn’t mean everyone should be indifferent to each other.

Author: Sara Shepard,  Pretty Little Liars
Quote: ,the rest of the girls pretended not to notice. That's just what best friends do.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Write like no one is reading 3
Quote: In today's classroom everybody wins a trophy, even the one kid who actually won. Soon it will be, let's punish that kid for making the other kids feel like losers.

Author: Jean-Paul Sartre
Quote: the worst part about being lied to is knowing you werent worth the truth

Author: Marianne Williamson,  A Return to Love: Reflections on the Principles of "A Course in Miracles"
Quote: Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous? Actually, who are you not to be?

Author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton
Quote: Truth is the only safe ground to stand on.

Author: Lisi Harrison
Quote: Truth is beauty

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title
Quote: There’s truth in only having a bicycle seat. I used to skip class and just hold it out in the hallway. When teachers would ask me what I was doing, I’d hold it up and say, “Sorry I’m late.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando
Quote: By the truth we are undone. Life is a dream. 'Tis the waking that kills us. He who robs us of our dreams robs us of our life.

Author: Ann Druyan
Quote: Interviewer: Didn't Sagan want to believe?Druyan: he didn't want to believe. he wanted to know.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Essential Writings of Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Whatever games are played with us, we must play no games with ourselves, but deal in our privacy with the last honesty and truth.

Author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird
Quote: Some negroes lie, some are immoral, some negro men are not be trusted around women - black and white. But this is a truth that applies to the human race and to no particular race of men.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: To force oneself to believe and to accept a thing without understanding is political, and not spiritual or intellectual.

Author: W.E.B. Du Bois,  The Souls of Black Folk
Quote: Herein lies the tragedy of the age: not that men are poor, — all men know something of poverty; not that men are wicked, — who is good? not that men are ignorant, — what is Truth? Nay, but that men know so little of men.

Author: Stephen King,  Bag of Bones
Quote: I felt lonely and content at the same time. I believe that is a rare kind of happiness.

Author: Richard Paul Evans,  The Sunflower
Quote: Feelings can be like wild animals-we underrate how fierce they are until we've opened their cage

Author: Rachel Vincent,  Shift
Quote: Why is this so hard?” I whispered.His pulse leaped crazily at my admission. “Everything worth fighting for is hard.

Author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain
Quote: Such a simple concept, yet so true: that which we manifest is before us; we are the creators of our own destiny. Be it through intention or ignorance, our successes and our failures have been brought on by none other than ourselves.

Author: Socrates
Quote: The greatest blessing granted to mankind come by way of madness, which is a divine gift.

Author: Blaise Pascal
Quote: It is man's natural sickness to believe that he possesses the truth.

Author: Jeffery Deaver,  The Bodies Left Behind
Quote: She was reflecting back on a truth she had learned over the years: that people heard what they wanted to hear, saw what they wanted, believed what they wanted.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  Lock and Key
Quote: The best gifts come from the heart, not the store.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

Author: Arthur C. Clarke,  The Exploration of Space
Quote: A faith that cannot survive collision with the truth is not worth many regrets.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Vision: Reflections on the Way of the Soul
Quote: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.

Author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
Quote: Facts are the enemy of truth.

Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
Quote: We are willing to believe anything other than the truth.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay
Quote: Knowing it and seeing it are two different things.

Author: Jacqueline Carey,  Kushiel's Dart
Quote: Yes my lord, but questions are dangerous, for they have answers

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: Speak the truth do not become angered and give when asked, even be it a little. By these three conditions one goes to the presence of the gods.

Author: Julien Smith,  The Flinch
Quote: You will never be entirely comfortable. This is the truth behind the champion - he is always fighting something. To do otherwise is to settle.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Red Pyramid
Quote: Why did adults have to be so thick? They always say “tell the truth,” and when you do, they don’t believe you. What’s the point?

Author: Michael Connelly,  Trunk Music
Quote: What is important is not what you hear said, it's what you observe.

Author: Thomas Aquinas
Quote: Better to illuminate than merely to shine to deliver to others contemplated truths than merely to contemplate.

Author: Christina Rossetti
Quote: What are heavy? sea-sand and sorrow.What are brief? today and tomorrow.What are frail? spring blossoms and youth.What are deep? the ocean and truth.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: A #startup is as fragile as a flower, and it needs a garden and a gardener to help it grow. Those gardens are called Business Incubators.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  A Room of One's Own
Quote: Why, if it was an illusion, not praise the catastrophe, whatever it was, that destroyed illusion and put truth in it's place?

Author: D.L. Moody
Quote: The best way to show that a stick is crooked is not to argue about it or to spend time denouncing it, but to lay a straight stick alongside it

Author: Jess Rothenberg,  The Catastrophic History of You and Me
Quote: News flash, Bozo. Don't ever tell a girl to relax. It only makes us madder.

Author: Hlovate,  Contengan Jalanan
Quote: Hidup hanya ada erti pada yang bahagia.

Author: Diane Setterfield,  The Thirteenth Tale
Quote: I've nothing against people who love truth. Apart from the fact that they make dull companions.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: Therefore, since we are receiving a kingdom that cannot be shaken, let us be thankful, and so worship God acceptably with reverence and awe, for our God is a consuming fire.

Author: Matt D. Miller
Quote: If you always attach positive emotions to the things you want, and never attach negative emotions to the things you don't, then that which you desire most will invariably come your way.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: To love someone with all of your heart requires reaching them where they are with the only words they can understand.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: Once you start recognizing the truth of your story, finish the story. It happened but you're still here, you're still capable, powerful, you're not your circumstance. It happened and you made it through. You're still fully equipped with every single tool you need to fulfill your purpose.

Author: William Pickens
Quote: To cheapen the lives of any group of men, cheapens the lives of all men, even our own. This is a law of human psychology, or human nature. And it will not be repealed by our wishes, nor will it be merciful to our blindness.

Author: Bruno Bettelheim,  The Uses of Enchantment: The Meaning and Importance of Fairy Tales
Quote: The child intuitively comprehends that although these stories are unreal, they are not untrue ...

Author: Marie Lu,  The Rose Society
Quote: The irony of life is that those who wear masks often tell us more truths than those with open faces.

Author: E.M. Forster,  Howards End
Quote: Death destroys a man: the idea of Death saves him.

Author: Mira Grant,  Feed
Quote: Alive or dead, the truth won't rest. Rise up while you can.

Author: Alex Flinn,  Beastly
Quote: when you're a kid, they tell you that it's what's on the inside that counts. Looks don't matter . But that's not true. Guys like Phoebus in The Hunchback, or Dorian, or the old Kyle Kingsbury-- they can be scumbags to women and still get away with it because they're good-looking. Being ugly is a kind of prisoner.

Author: Mariah Carey
Quote: when you feel like hope is gone, look inside you and be strong and you'll finally see the truth- that hero lies in you.

Author: E.M. Forster,  A Room with a View
Quote: It is so difficult - at least, I find it difficult - to understand people who speak the truth.

Author: Ann Landers
Quote: The naked truth is always better than the best-dressed lie.

Author: Dan Brown,  The Da Vinci Code
Quote: Learning the truth has become my life's love.

Author: Criss Jami,  Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality
Quote: Don't change your mind just because people are offended; change your mind if you're wrong.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: If someone can prove me wrong and show me my mistake in any thought or action, I shall gladly change. I seek the truth, which never harmed anyone: the harm is to persist in one's own self-deception and ignorance.

Author: Carl von Clausewitz,  On War: Volume 1
Quote: If the mind is to emerge unscathed from this relentless struggle with the unforeseen, two qualities are indispensable: first, an intellect that, even in the darkest hour, retains some glimmerings of the inner light which leads to truth; and second, the courage to follow this faint light wherever it may lead.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: When you look at the past without God’s eyes, you subject yourself to deception. The past no longer exists and God doesn’t linger there. However, Satan will show you whatever you want to see and believe, so you will be trapped in an emotion that cannot communicate truth, beyond what you want to remember.

Author: Jon Katz
Quote: It is difficult to see ourselves as we are. Sometimes we are fortunate enough to have good friends, lovers or others who will do us the good service of telling us the truth about ourselves. When we don't, we can so easily delude ourselves, lose a sense of truth about ourselves, and our conscience loses power and purpose. Mostly, we tell ourselves what we would like to hear. We lose our way.

Author: Peter Cameron,  Someday This Pain Will Be Useful to You
Quote: I only feel like myself when I am alone.

Author: Bob Ong,  Ang Paboritong Libro ni Hudas
Quote: hindi dahil sa hindi mo naiintindihan ang isang bagay ay kasinungalingan na ito. at hindi lahat ng kaya mong intindihin ay katotohanan.

Author: Radiohead
Quote: Most people gaze neither into the past nor the future; they explore neither truth nor lies. They gaze at the television.

Author: Alex Rogers,  I'm Only Human After All
Quote: Too many people out there tell us what we can and cannot do but…they don’t know who we are, what’s put in us.

Author: Anthony de Mello
Quote: If what you seek is Truth, there is one thing you must have above all else.” “I know. An overwhelming passion for it.” “No. An unremitting readiness to admit you may be wrong.

Author: John Locke
Quote: To love truth for truth's sake is the principal part of human perfection in this world, and the seed-plot of all other virtues.

Author: Alan Keightley
Quote: Once in a while it really hits people that they don't have to experience the world in the way they have been told to.

Author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut
Quote: Eyes shows lies.

Author: Patrick Henry
Quote: For my part, whatever anguish of spirit it may cost, I am willing to know the whole truth; to know the worst and to provide for it.

Author: David Levithan,  Will Grayson, Will Grayson
Quote: You know there's no such thing as a complete lie. There's always some truth in there.

Author: Wayne W. Dyer
Quote: Before speaking, consult your inner-truth barometer, and resist the temptation to tell people only what they want to hear.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Choke
Quote: The truth is, immigrants tend to be more American than people born here.

Author: Anatole France
Quote: It is the certainty that they possess the truth that makes men cruel.

Author: Lev Grossman,  The Magicians
Quote: The truth doesn't always make a good story, does it?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Titanic would never have sunk if it were made out of a sink.
Quote: There’s truth and honor in a mustache. And that’s why I started flying one on the flagpole outside of my house.

Author: Chris Crutcher,  Deadline
Quote: But the truth doesn't need to be known, or believed, to be true.

Author: Huntley Fitzpatrick,  My Life Next Door
Quote: No words for a long time. Which is fine, because even the most important ones-- I love you. I'm sorry. Forgive me? I'm here-- are only stand-ins for what you can say better without talking at all.

Author: Swami Vivekananda
Quote: Comfort is no test of truth. Truth is often far from being comfortable.

Author: Robin Jones Gunn,  Gardenias for Breakfast
Quote: It's funny whom we end up choosing to love and who ends up choosing to love us. It's rarely the people we think it should be.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Accomplishments don’t erase shame, hatred, cruelty, silence, ignorance, discrimination, low self-esteem or immorality. It covers it up, with a creative version of pride and ego. Only restitution, forgiving yourself and others, compassion, repentance and living with dignity will ever erase the past.

Author: Juliet Marillier,  Daughter of the Forest
Quote: There is no truth on this island of yours. Rather, there are as many truths as there are stars in the sky; and every one of them different.

Author: Amit Ray,  OM Sutra: The Pathway to Enlightenment
Quote: Truth is neither in the scripture nor in the words of prophets. It is in your heart, feel it, discover it and expand with it.

Author: George Orwell,  1984
Quote: He was a lonely ghost uttering a truth that nobody would ever hear.

Author: Oswald Chambers
Quote: The author who benefits you most is not the one who tells you something you did not know before, but the one who gives expression to the truth that has been dumbly struggling in you for utterance.

Author: Horace Greeley
Quote: It is impossible to enslave, mentally or socially, a bible-reading people. The principles of the bible are the groundwork of human freedom.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.

Author: David Mitchell,  Ghostwritten
Quote: Integrity is a bugger, it really is. Lying can get you into difficulties, but to really wind up in the crappers try telling nothing but the truth.

Author: P.C. Cast,  Awakened
Quote: What more could you want? How about dominion over this 'beautiful place'? Beauty doesn't last. Friends and family decay. Power is the only thing that goes on forever."Jack answered with his gut. "No, love goes on forever.

Author: Eduardo Galeano
Quote: I have never killed anybody, it is true, but it is because I lacked the courage or the time, not because I lacked the desire

Author: Jess C. Scott,  EyeLeash: A Blog Novel
Quote: I was flipping channels, watching this cheerleading program on MTV. They took a field hockey girl and “transformed” her into a cheerleader by the end of the show. I was just wondering: what if she liked field hockey better?

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Non-violence, which is the quality of the heart, cannot come by an appeal to the brain.

Author: D.J. MacHale
Quote: Because this is the way things are meant to be.(Press Tilton)

Author: L.J. Smith,  The Forbidden Game
Quote: The image isn't reality. Even though we're used to thinking that way alot of the time. We show a kid a picture of a dog and say 'This is a doggie' - but it's not. It's just an image.

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
Quote: If someone proved to me that Christ is outside the truth, and that in reality the truth were outside of Christ, then I should prefer to remain with Christ rather than with the truth.

Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Quote: Freedom means the supremacy of human rights everywhere. Our support goes to those who struggle to gain those rights and keep them. Our strength is our unity of purpose. To that high concept there can be no end save victory.

Author: Patricia Briggs,  Raven's Strike
Quote: Some truths are truths, no matter who says them.

Author: Gene Wilder
Quote: If you're not gonna tell the truth, then why start talking?

Author: Thomas H. Cook,  Master of the Delta
Quote: He looked at me intently, from what seemed behind the veil of a grave experience. Then slowly and prophetically, he said the scariest thing I'd ever heard: "Because the answer to a heartfelt question, Jack, will always break your heart.

Author: Peter Lamborn Wilson
Quote: Those who understand history are condemned to watch other idiots repeat it.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Truth resides in every human heart,and one has to search for it there,and to be guided by truth as one sees it.But no one has a right to coerce othersto act according to his own view of truth.

Author: Alison Weir,  Innocent Traitor
Quote: If only they would all just leave me alone with my books and my letters, I would be content to let life, and the world pass me by

Author: Rick Yancey,  The Infinite Sea
Quote: You never know when the truth will come home. You can’t choose the time. The time chooses you.

Author: James Dashner,  The Death Cure
Quote: What was the point of even having a conversation when words couldn't be trusted?

Author: Seth Grahame-Smith,  Pride and Prejudice and Zombies
Quote: Of all the weapons she had commanded, Elizabeth knew the least of love; and of all the weapons in the world, love was the most dangerous.

Author: Jane Kenyon
Quote: The poet's job is to put into words those feelings we all have that are so deep, so important, and yet so difficult to name, to tell the truth in such a beautiful way, that people cannot live without it.

Author: Stacia Kane,  Unholy Ghosts
Quote: IF her life had taught her anything, it was that you never really knew what people had going on beneath the surface. People were shit. The only difference between them and animals was people felt the need to hide it.

Author: Romain Rolland,  Above the Battle
Quote: Discussion is impossible with someone who claims not to seek the truth, but already to possess it.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  The Other Side of Life
Quote: Nin knew how much humans loved money, riches, and material things—though he never really could understand why. The more technologically advanced the human species got, the more isolated they seemed to become, at the same time. It was alarming, how humans could spend entire lifetimes engaged in all kinds of activities, without getting any closer to knowing who they really were, inside.

Author: Robert Brault
Quote: Today I bent the truth to be kind, and I have no regret, for I am far surer of what is kind than I am of what is true.

Author: Anthony de Mello
Quote: Any time you are with anyone or think of anyone you must say to yourself: I am dying and this person too is dying, attempting the while to experience the truth of the words you are saying. If every one of you agrees to practice this, bitterness will die out, harmony will arise.

Author: Pliny the Elder,  Natural History
Quote: In wine, there's truth.

Author: Paul Auster,  The Brooklyn Follies
Quote: The truth of the story lies in the details.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Opportunity is not your opponent—it is your ally, but it’s hard to see that because opportunity is often camouflaged and hidden among danger and chaos.

Author: Lisa Genova,  Still Alice
Quote: ... just because [butterflies'] lives were short didn't mean they were tragic... See, they have a beautiful life.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye

Author: Suzy Kassem

Author: Margaret Dilloway,  How to Be an American Housewife

Author: H.L. Mencken

Author: Toba Beta,  Betelgeuse Incident: Insiden Bait Al-Jauza

Author: Claudius Galenus

Author: Stephen Cbosky

Author: Muriel Spark,  The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
