Quote: The ethos of redemption is realied in self-mastery, by means of temperance, that is, continence of desires.

Author: Melody Carlson,  Just Another Girl
Quote: While Owen and Miles talk sports, I people watch. And this is what I see: teenagers trying to act like adults. Or how they think adults act. But mostly they look ridiculous, and I wonder what they don't want to do something that's more fun than drinking, smoking, flirting, and making out. Why are those activities considered to be fun?

Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley,  The Necessity of Atheism and Other Essays
Quote: In fact, the truth cannot be communicated until it is perceived.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Truth is handsomer than the affectation of love. Your goodness must have some edge to it--else it is none.

Author: Nikolai A. Berdyaev
Quote: There is a tragic clash between Truth and the world. Pure undistorted truth burns up the world.

Author: Alistair MacLean,  Fear is the Key
Quote: She had the best kind of courage, or maybe the worst kind, the kind that gets you into trouble.

Author: Werner Erhard
Quote: Man keeps looking for a truth that fits his reality. Given our reality, the truth doesn't fit.

Author: Coco Chanel
Quote: A woman with good shoes i never ugly!

Author: Morgan Rhodes,  Rebel Spring
Quote: I think most are too afraid to see the truth.

Author: Morrissey
Quote: I do maintain that if your hair is wrong, your entire life is wrong.

Author: Suzy Kassem
Quote: Truth can only be seen by those with truth in them.

Author: Richelle Mead,  Spirit Bound
Quote: I shot up,now as angry and frusterated as him.I had a feeling if i stayed, we'd both snap. In and undertone, I murmured,"this isnt over.i won't give up on you.""I've given up on you,"he said back,voice also soft. "Love fades. Mine has.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  Ecce Homo
Quote: How much truth does a spirit endure, how much truth does it dare?

Author: Peter Kreeft,  Pocket Handbook of Christian Apologetics
Quote: We can't believe what we believe to be untrue, and we can't love what we believe to be unreal.

Author: F. Paul Wilson,  Healer
Quote: Reality is what trips you up when you walk around with your eyes closed.

Author: Louis-Ferdinand Céline,  Journey to the End of the Night
Quote: And where, I ask you, can a man escape to, when he hasn’t enough madness left inside him? The truth is an endless death agony. The truth is death. You have to choose: death or lies. I’ve never been able to kill myself.

Author: Kurt Busiek,  Superman: Secret Identity
Quote: Maybe I had a "secret identity", but then when you think about it, don't we all? A part of ourselves very few people ever get to see. The part we think of as "me". The part that deals with the big stuff. Makes the real choices. The part everything else is a reflection of.

Author: Tanjlisa Marie
Quote: Give me the facts and I will determine my own truths.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Antony and Cleopatra
Quote: That truth should be silent I had almost forgot. (Enobarbus)

Author: Robert G. Ingersoll,  The Ghosts and Other Lectures
Quote: Nothing but truth is immortal.

Author: Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha
Quote: God is not interested in your art but, your heart.

Author: Ali Shariati
Quote: وقتی در صحنه ی حق وباطل نیستیهر کجا خواهی باش ، چه به نماز ایستاده باشیچه به شراب ،هر دو یکی است...

Author: George Orwell,  1984
Quote: The words kept coming back to him, statement of a mystical truth and a palpable absurdity.

Author: Mark Helprin,  Winter's Tale
Quote: The beauty of truth is that it need not be proclaimed or believed. It skips from soul to soul, changing form each time it touches, but it is what it is, I have seen it, and someday you will, too.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Tolerance! The virtue that makes one bite his tongue so that he can tear out his hair.

Author: William Montgomery Watt,  Muhammad at Mecca
Quote: His readiness to undergo persecutions for his beliefs, the high moral character of the men who believed in him and looked up to him as leader, and the greatness of his ultimate achievement - all argue his fundamental integrity. To suppose Muhammad an impostor raises more problems than it solves. Moreover, none of the great figures of history is so poorly appreciated in the West as Muhammad

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: In fact, it is more correct to say that Truth is God, than to say that God is Truth.

Author: Benson Bruno,  A Story That Talks about Talking Is Like Chatter to Chattering Teeth, and Every Set of Dentures Can Attest to the Fact That No..
Quote: Can Power speak the truth to love? These men certainly blurted it out. And what did we learn from them? That power is blind, and love at first sight is a fickle judge of those who grasp too desperately.

Author: Sergei Lukyanenko,  Night Watch
Quote: What was my truth worth, if I was prepared to defend the entire world, but not those who were close to me? If I subdued hate, but wouldn't give love a chance?

Author: Carl Sagan,  The Varieties of Scientific Experience: A Personal View of the Search for God
Quote: So those who wished for some central cosmic purpose for us, or at least our world, or at least our solar system, or at least our galaxy, have been disappointed, progressively disappointed. The universe is not responsive to our ambitious expectations.

Author: Anthony Liccione
Quote: A trusting heart will follow, only those who truly follow their heart.

Author: David Cook
Quote: Whether your pleasing or pissing everybody off, your doing something wrong.

Author: Dean Koontz
Quote: The truth was stranger than the official fiction.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: I always make sure that the world will prove me right. It gives me the freedom to contradict myself.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: Truth has to be repeated constantly, because Error also is being preached all the time, and not just by a few, but by the multitude. In the Press and Encyclopaedias, in Schools and Universities, everywhere Error holds sway, feeling happy and comfortable in the knowledge of having Majority on its side.

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: Love is the sister to Truth, but they differ in two ways. You must go to Truth to find her. She will never come looking for you. However, you are never to go looking for her sister Love. Love will find you in your own divine timing, when you are ready for her. So don't look, she will come. She always does.

Author: Patti Callahan Henry,  Between the Tides
Quote: We have to know the truth about the past to discover out future.

Author: Jacqueline Carey,  Kushiel's Chosen
Quote: And having once chosen, never to seek to return to the crossroads of that decision-for even if one chooses wrongly, the choice cannot be unmade.

Author: Lily Tomlin
Quote: Lady, I do not make up things. That is lies. Lies are not true. But the truth could be made up if yo know how. And that's the truth.

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: A man who tells you to follow him will turn his followers into his company, while a true leader who does not tell you to follow him, will sit in the company of his followers.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: You believe what your eyes want to believe!

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: Speak up, stand up, and keep correcting the false perceptions. Stay true to your heart's views and keep chanting for peace and justice.
